Package edu.pjatk.inn.coffeemaker.impl

Class Recipe

java.lang.Object
edu.pjatk.inn.coffeemaker.impl.Recipe
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Recipe
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

The Recipe class represents as recipe of coffee for CoffeeMaker() class.

Recipe class instance can be utilized by getContext(edu.pjatk.inn.coffeemaker.impl.Recipe).

Contains features that are used to create and manage coffee recipe.

Implements Serializable interface.

Attributes of Recipe represent composition of coffee ingredients:

name, price, amtCoffee, amtMilk, amtSugar, amtChocolate

Documentation creators (not authors):

  • Tilek Mukambetov
  • Ulzhan Akmurat
  • Artem Kholodenko
Since:
1.0
See Also:

    • getRecipe

      public static Recipe getRecipe​(sorcer.service.Context context) throws sorcer.service.ContextException
      Creates a new Recipe object, which attributes defined by Context.getValue(java.lang.String, sorcer.service.Arg...) elements.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      recipe - the new Recipe object.
      Throws:
      sorcer.service.ContextException - if Context.getValue(java.lang.String, sorcer.service.Arg...) method failed or Context element value is not suitable to cast.

      Context

    • getContext

      public static sorcer.service.Context getContext​(Recipe recipe) throws sorcer.service.ContextException
      Creates a new Context object, which elements defined by Recipe() attributes.
      Parameters:
      recipe - the Recipe argument.
      Returns:
      context - the new Context instance.
      Throws:
      sorcer.service.ContextException - if Context.putValue(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object) method failed.
      See Also:
      Context
